title: How to Prepare for an OSHA Inspection
summary: A practical checklist to prepare your job site and documentation for an OSHA inspection.

sections.heading: Documentation Readiness
body: Ensure air monitoring records, training logs, and exposure assessments are accessible.
Incomplete documentation is a common citation.

sections.heading: Site Conditions
body: Verify engineering controls, PPE, and housekeeping meet regulatory standards.
Inspectors often focus on visible hazards.

sections.heading: Employee Interviews
body: Workers should understand hazards and protective measures.
Training records must match actual practices.
